docs.snippet: Caster Semenya of South Africa and other female athletes with high testosterone levels should not be punished for their condition....
docs.lead_paragraph: Caster Semenya of South Africa and other female athletes with high testosterone levels should not be punished for their condition.
docs.abstract: Editorial supports International Olympic Committee decision allowing women with hyperandrogenism, or excess of male hormone, to compete in Rio without artificially reducing their testosterone levels;  argues condition is biological abnormality for which athletes, like South African runner Caster Semenya, should not be punished.

headline.main: Who Gets to Race as a Woman?
